segment.source: Using provisioning files to update registry settings that may change
segment.target: Using provisioning files to update registry settings that may change

segment.source: Using provisioning files to update registry settings that may change
segment.target: Using provisioning files to update registry settings that may change

segment.source: Using provisioning files to update registry settings that may change
segment.target: Using provisioning files to update registry settings that may change

segment.source: Standard package updates are not applied to registry data that have been changed—for example, by a user who alters a menu setting that is stored in the registry.
segment.target: Standard package updates are not applied to registry data that have been changed—for example, by a user who alters a menu setting that is stored in the registry.

segment.source: To update the values of this category of registry data, provisioning XML (provxml) must be used.
segment.target: To update the values of this category of registry data, provisioning XML (provxml) must be used.

segment.source: If provxml is not used to update the registry data that has been changed since the device was flashed in the factory, the update will report success to the user, but the registry changes in a standard update will not be applied.
segment.target: If provxml is not used to update the registry data that has been changed since the device was flashed in the factory, the update will report success to the user, but the registry changes in a standard update will not be applied.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Registry updates for entries that will not be changed can be handled by using standard updates.
segment.target: Registry updates for entries that will not be changed can be handled by using standard updates.

segment.source: Only use provxml files in updates when there is an unavoidable need to update registry entries that may change.
segment.target: Only use provxml files in updates when there is an unavoidable need to update registry entries that may change.

segment.source: Registry update strategies
segment.target: Registry update strategies

segment.source: To avoid the need to update existing registry data, your code could be updated to read the existing registry data and migrate it to a new key, so that any existing user settings are preserved.
segment.target: To avoid the need to update existing registry data, your code could be updated to read the existing registry data and migrate it to a new key, so that any existing user settings are preserved.

segment.source: Alternatively, approaches such as adding a version number check when the application starts (to determine which registry values to use) may be appropriate.
segment.target: Alternatively, approaches such as adding a version number check when the application starts (to determine which registry values to use) may be appropriate.

segment.source: If none of these approaches are possible, provxml can be used to overwrite the existing registry settings.
segment.target: If none of these approaches are possible, provxml can be used to overwrite the existing registry settings.

segment.source: Updating registry settings with provxml
segment.target: Updating registry settings with provxml

segment.source: Most updates can be created without the need for provisioning XML (provxml).
segment.target: Most updates can be created without the need for provisioning XML (provxml).

segment.source: But there are certain situations where the use of provxml may be required.
segment.target: But there are certain situations where the use of provxml may be required.

segment.source: If a registry value can be modified by a user setting or code that executes on the phone at any time before the update is applied, standard package updates respect those changes and do not overwrite the existing registry data.
segment.target: If a registry value can be modified by a user setting or code that executes on the phone at any time before the update is applied, standard package updates respect those changes and do not overwrite the existing registry data.

segment.source: In this situation, the provxml described here must be used.
segment.target: In this situation, the provxml described here must be used.

segment.source: You can use OMA CP provisioning using provxml.
segment.target: You can use OMA CP provisioning using provxml.

segment.source: This sample provxml sets the value of a single registry entry.
segment.target: This sample provxml sets the value of a single registry entry.

segment.source: Use the following syntax for the provxml file naming:
segment.target: Use the following syntax for the provxml file naming:

segment.source: For the value of n for the first update, start with 001 and increment the value for each subsequent update.
segment.target: For the value of n for the first update, start with 001 and increment the value for each subsequent update.

segment.source: All provxml updates are applied in the order specified by n.
segment.target: All provxml updates are applied in the order specified by n.

segment.source: Creating a package for the provxml
segment.target: Creating a package for the provxml

segment.source: Create a package file that places these files in the proper update directory as shown.
segment.target: Create a package file that places these files in the proper update directory as shown.

segment.source: Provide an appropriate Owner value.
segment.target: Provide an appropriate Owner value.

segment.source: For more info, see Primary elements and attributes of a package project file.
segment.target: For more info, see Primary elements and attributes of a package project file.

segment.source: Generate the package, and then include the provisioning package in the OS image that will be used to submit updates to Microsoft.
segment.target: Generate the package, and then include the provisioning package in the OS image that will be used to submit updates to Microsoft.

segment.source: For more information, see Creating packages and Submit an update.
segment.target: For more information, see Creating packages and Submit an update.

segment.source: Resetting the phone and provxml registry updates
segment.target: Resetting the phone and provxml registry updates

segment.source: Update provxml files are processed after an update has been applied to the device.
segment.target: Update provxml files are processed after an update has been applied to the device.

segment.source: When the update is applied, the registry changes are stored in both the base OS image and the current, active registry.
segment.target: When the update is applied, the registry changes are stored in both the base OS image and the current, active registry.

segment.source: This means that when the device is reset, the registry changes that were delivered in an update are present, but updates to associated store apps that use those registry settings may not be present on the device.
segment.target: This means that when the device is reset, the registry changes that were delivered in an update are present, but updates to associated store apps that use those registry settings may not be present on the device.

segment.source: As OEMs prepare updates, they must identify possible usage scenarios, such as the phone being reset, and test those to create the desired user experience.
segment.target: As OEMs prepare updates, they must identify possible usage scenarios, such as the phone being reset, and test those to create the desired user experience.

segment.source: Testing provisioning file in updates
segment.target: Testing provisioning file in updates

segment.source: Two scenarios must be tested to validate an update provisioning file:
segment.target: Two scenarios must be tested to validate an update provisioning file:

segment.source: Update—Using a base image, apply the update.
segment.target: Update—Using a base image, apply the update.

segment.source: Verify that the changes in the provxml were applied.
segment.target: Verify that the changes in the provxml were applied.

segment.source: Reset—To test this after the phone has been updated, use SettingsSystemAboutReset your phone.
segment.target: Reset—To test this after the phone has been updated, use SettingsSystemAboutReset your phone.

segment.source: Verify that the update changes in the provxml were applied.
segment.target: Verify that the update changes in the provxml were applied.

segment.source: It is important to verify that the update will work properly if the user has altered settings that the update targets.
segment.target: It is important to verify that the update will work properly if the user has altered settings that the update targets.

segment.source: In addition, the standard guidance for update testing should be followed.
segment.target: In addition, the standard guidance for update testing should be followed.

segment.source: For more info, see Test an update.
segment.target: For more info, see Test an update.

segment.source: Provxml update error handling
segment.target: Provxml update error handling

segment.source: During an update, provxml files are processed on a best-effort basis.
segment.target: During an update, provxml files are processed on a best-effort basis.

segment.source: If a provxml file cannot be processed due to formatting errors or permissions issues, the file is skipped, and processing of subsequent provxmls continues.
segment.target: If a provxml file cannot be processed due to formatting errors or permissions issues, the file is skipped, and processing of subsequent provxmls continues.

segment.source: In development of the prvoxml, you can check the status that is stored in the registry at HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionDataMigrationFrameworkProvisioningStatusMicrosoft.
segment.target: In development of the prvoxml, you can check the status that is stored in the registry at HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionDataMigrationFrameworkProvisioningStatusMicrosoft.

segment.source: A registry entry is created for each provxml file that is processed, and the HRESULT from processing the file is stored as the entry value.
segment.target: A registry entry is created for each provxml file that is processed, and the HRESULT from processing the file is stored as the entry value.
